Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Level Description: Proficient (shows most elements clearly and correctly)
CAN: The student can draw a fish and label it, including key parts like the body and fins.
The student can draw and label the water environment where the fish lives, such as a pond or an ocean.
The student can identify and label at least two resources the fish needs from its habitat, such as water for swimming and plants for providing oxygen.
The student can draw and label other parts of the fish's habitat, such as surrounding plants or rocks.
CANNOT: The student might not clearly label all interactions between the fish and its environment (e.g., the role of plants in providing oxygen may be left unlabeled or vaguely labeled).

The student might struggle to demonstrate a full understanding of the habitat as a system, possibly leaving out some interconnections between components, like how plants contribute to the fish's survival beyond being drawn in the background.
